patterns: What are features of Flexi term Loan?
responses:
• A Flexi Term Loan is an industry-first facility being extended by Bajaj Finserv to our premium customers.
• It is a hybrid product combining the features of both, a term loan and a written down value based loan limit.
• With this product you can pre-pay and drawdown money as many times you want, making the process easy and hassle-free.
• Interest is charged only on the amount drawn by you and not the entire loan amount.
• On availing this, you benefit by saving interest cost as you can pre-pay the loan at no extra cost.
• Your drawing power reduces on monthly basis thereby reducing the approved loan amount to zero at the end of loan tenor.

patterns: What is the benefit of a Flexi facility compared to a normal term loan?
responses:
Flexi Loans offer many benefits compared to normal term loan:
1. You have the flexibility to pre-pay the loan with idle funds.
2. You can re-avail the pre-paid amount within the drop-line facility at any time within the loan tenor timeframe without any additional documentation.
3. You save on interest costs – interest is payable only on the utilised loan amount. There is no interest levied on the pre-paid amount.
4. Seamless, easy, hassle-free online transactions on the Bajaj Finserv's internet portal– Experia, the self-service account access tool for drawdown and RTGS, that allows you to make pre-payments to BFL through netbanking transactions.

patterns: What are the key constituents of dropline facility?
responses:
Following are the constituents of dropline based amortization:
1. Dropline balance: It is a running loan facility which keeps on dropping over the tenor.
2. Utilised amount: Amount utilized by you. This is the POS (principal outstanding).
3. Available balance: This is the amount you can drawdown (calculated as the difference between dropline balance and utilised amount).

patterns: What will be the billing cycle?
responses: Billing cycle will be from 26th to 25th of every month and the same will be due on 5th of the following month.

patterns: What would be my instalment payment date?
responses: The instalment payment date for all Flexi Loans will be 5th of every month.

patterns: How will the interest be calculated if the customer withdraws or part prepay after the billing cycle?
responses:
For all transactions that are executed between 26th to 25th of the month, you will be charged for the specific number of days the amount has been utilized.
For e.g., if you have a loan limit of Rs.10 lakh and you draw down Rs.10 lakh on the 26th of the month & pre-pay Rs.5 lakh on the 29th of the same month thereby utilizing only Rs.5 lakh from 29th of that month to the 25th of the next month, then you will be charged interest on Rs.10 lakh from 26th – 29th and on Rs.5 lakh from 30th – 25th.
Similarly, if you have a loan limit of Rs.15 lakh and draw down Rs.10 lakh on the 26th of the month and on 29th, draw down another Rs.5 lakh thereby utilizing the full available balance, you will be charged for Rs.10 lakh from 26th – 29th of the month and on Rs.15 lakh from 30th – 25th of the next month.

patterns: Would the interest rates be the same/lower compared to a normal term loan?
responses: Please refer to the fees and charges section for the detailed list of charges applicable on term loans and Flexi Term Loans.

patterns: Is there any charge for pre-payment against Flexi Loan?
responses: There is no charge for pre-payment. As a Flexi Loan customer, you can transact (make payments in your account and drawdown within the available balance amount) any number of times.

patterns: When can I make the first part prepayment?
responses: Part prepayment can be done post 36 hours of loan disbursement.

patterns: How many times can I make a part pre-payment?
responses: A Flexi Term Loan customer can make part prepayments on his loan as many times as he wants. There is no limit to the number of part-prepayments in a day.

patterns: How many times can I withdraw from my Flexi Term Loan in a day?
responses: Currently, you can withdraw a maximum of five times a day.

patterns: Can I withdraw and part prepay in the same day?
responses: Yes, you can withdraw and part-prepay in the same day.

patterns: In how much time will the money be credited to my account?

patterns: I have made a prepayment before my EMI date. Do I still need to pay my instalment?
responses: Yes, the instalment will be deducted on the due date, irrespective of part-prepayment amount. Since the EMI is recovered on amount utilized during the billing period.

patterns: How long will it take for part-prepayment and withdrawal to come into effect in the statement of account?

responses: Minimum amount of Rs.80 Thousand and a maximum of Rs.15 lacs can be availed.

patterns: Will the monthly instalment/EMI of a Flexi Term Loan contain a principal amount?
responses: In a Flexi Term Loan, you will pay only interest in the form of EMI. For example: A Flexi Term Loan amount of Rs.5 lakhs will have an EMI of approximately Rs.6,000 (only Interest) and not regular EMI of Rs. 12,000.

responses: If any part-payment or withdrawal is made before the 22nd of any month, the change in EMI will reflect in the very next month. If not, changes will reflect with a one-month lag.

patterns: What is the annual maintenance charges collection cycle date?

patterns: How can I convert Flexi Term Loan to a Term Loan?
responses:

• Customer service will take your consent and raise a request on your behalf.
• Post this, your Flexi Term Loan will be converted into a term loan for 60 months and a regular EMI including the principal amount.

responses: Yes, a new Flexi Term Loan will be booked with a new agreement and existing loan will be closed.

patterns: What is the procedure to convert flexi loan facility to Term Loan?

Customer service will take your consent and put a request on your behalf. Post this your flexi loan facility will be converted into a term loan for 60 months and a regular EMI will start coming in which the Principle will also be included.

patterns: Under what scenarios is flexi loan facility blocked for usage?
responses:
Your usage of a Flexi Term Loan facility can be blocked due to:
• Bounce of your monthly instalment with Bajaj Finance Limited or other any other financial institution
• Drop in your credit bureau score
• Change in employment
• Change in contact information (unless intimated in advance to Bajaj Finance Limited).
